properties.name: 3 Semaines de 40 degrees
properties.description: Posted by MythsterparisDepuis je suis ici a Austin je me demandes pourquois ca ma pris aussi longtemps d\'arriver. Et maintenant je me demandes c\'est que je me foutres (? ortho) ici. Ca fais 2 mois qu\'ill fais plus de quarantes degrees.

properties.name: A month in the Monastery Wat Thaton
properties.description: Posted by MythsterThailandBuddhist monastery in northern Thailand where I studied "Walking Meditation

properties.name: Appartment in New York where I lived in the mid 1940's
properties.description: Posted by MythsterE 48th St New York, NYTop floor of a walk-up in what was called the "Tutle Bay Area" of NYC

properties.name: Buddhist Monastery near Katmandu
properties.description: Posted by MythsterNepalFPMT Monastery close to the capital. I stayed here for a few weeks in 2004and then went Pokhara

properties.name: Hilton Hotel in Caracas
properties.description: Posted by Mythster Caracas, VenezuelaGuard towers on the four perimters. The guards all had machine guns. Don\'t try to skip without payng your bill! I stayed here when I had business in Caracas. I found Caracas a scary place. OK to visit but...

properties.name: Home in the Heartland
properties.description: Posted by Mythster8613 Neider Dr, Austin TX78749Right here, in the middle of the heartland, I settled down. I\'ve been here for about 7 years and I can\'t imagine living anywhere else except right now in the midst of the summer. I wish I coud be somewhere else- right now!

properties.name: Kookooligit Mountains
properties.description: Posted by Mythster0.000000, 0.000000

properties.name: My Birthplace
properties.description: Posted by MythsterChicago, ILI was born on the South Side but I don\'t know the exact address. I lived here with my parents for about three years until we moved to NYC

properties.name: My Current Home
properties.description: Posted by Mythster 8613 Neider Dr, Austin TX78749Just a house in heartland

properties.name: My first home in France
properties.description: Posted by MythsterRue St. Jacques, Paris FranceFunky appartment in the Rue des Ursulines, Paris left bank, not far from Les Jardins de Luxembourg. Lived there in the early 1950\'s

properties.name: My restaurant Chez Danielle
properties.description: Posted by Mythster State St. Santa Barbara, CAFrench style retaurant in Santa Barbara

properties.name: Mysterious City
properties.description: Posted by MythsterPraguePrague, for me, was a strange and unsettling experience, I found the people cold and unapproachable even though I spoke a little Czech plus German and Polish. One of the few places I\'ve visited where I felt I wasn\'t welcome (North Korea is another)

properties.name: New Otani Hotel Tokyo
properties.description: Posted by Mythster TokyoA very beatiful and comfortable hotel. I stayed here for a week during one of my visits to Japan

properties.name: Our Appartment in Milan's Chinatown
properties.description: Posted by MythsterVia Canonica Milan, ItalyFirst place I lived in when I moved to Milan from New York in 1964

properties.name: Our house in London
properties.description: Posted by MythsterNotting Hill Gate London Englandlived here in the 1970\'s before we moved to Limpley Stoke

properties.name: Paradise Found
properties.description: Posted by MythsterBaliThe island of Bali, the land of the smiling people. I\'ve rarely experienced such friendliness, courtesy and genuine helpfulness

properties.name: Stockholm
properties.description: Posted by MythsterStockholm, SwedenI had a girl firend here. The summers were truly beautiful but the winters were hell. She wanted me to settle there but after spending Christmas there. I never went back

properties.name: The Bridge, Limpley Stoke
properties.description: Posted by MythsterLimpley Stoke, EnglandWe had a restaurant here called "Danielle"and lived on premises

properties.name: The Land of the Happy People
properties.description: Posted by MythsterBali IndonesiaBali High! It was just like in South Pacific. The people were really friendly and helpful. I could live here (if my wife would let me)

properties.name: The Magic Island
properties.description: Posted by MythsterHong KongThere is absolutely nowhere like Hong Kong. The bay of Kowloon is worth the long trip from Europe. I have been back but my first impressions are the best.

properties.name: Venezia
properties.description: Posted by MythsterVenice, ItalyThere are a few places I been to that lived up to or surpassed my expectations. Venezia is one. I\'ve been there several times and each time is a magical experience. The firstwas an uncanny "deja vu".
